modern hotel and homes for tirana

Valerio Olgiati, the renowned Swiss architect, has recently unveiled his design for Grand Park Skyline, a premium residential complex in Tirana, Albania. Situated on the edge of Grand Park Lake, the development comprises two residential structures, a hotel, and a ziggurat, each conceived with a focus on modern luxury living while integrating with the surrounding context.

The complex introduces 530 residential apartments, 184 hotel rooms, two restaurants, a pool, a rooftop spa and gym, and over 800 underground parking spaces. The buildings are designed to maximize natural light and offer panoramic views of the lake and surrounding park. The hotel, in particular, emphasizes a connection to nature, with an emphasis on tranquility and world-class service.

architecture by valerio olgiati

With the Grand Park Skyline in Tirana, Valerio Olgiati prioritizes a minimalist aesthetic, emphasizing clean lines and a restrained material palette. The ziggurat, a prominent feature of the development, is a testament to this approach, its form a striking contrast to the surrounding landscape. The architect has sought to create a harmonious balance between the built environment and the natural setting, ensuring that the development enhances the existing beauty of the location.

The design emphasizes a connection to the surrounding park and lake, with generous outdoor spaces and carefully considered views. A minimalist aesthetic of clean lines, restrained materials, and a focus on simplicity characterize the architectural language. The iconic ‘Ziggurat’ structure will serve as a focal point for the development, its form a bold contrast to the surrounding context. Meanwhile, the team places an emphasis on natural light, as large windows and carefully considered openings maximize sunlight and ventilation throughout the buildings.
